item.title: The Nerd Knows His Red Balls
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: One of our favorite pseudonymous bloggers, the L.A. City Nerd (c'mon, Antonio, we know it's you) has made one of the most rare of sightings, a new red 76 Ball in the wild and on the move. Visit his blog to see how carefully the balls are transported to their new homes in the sky. […]
item.content:encoded:
One of our favorite pseudonymous bloggers, the L.A. City Nerd (c'mon, Antonio, we know it's you) has made one of the most rare of sightings, a new red 76 Ball in the wild and on the move. Visit his blog to see how carefully the balls are transported to their new homes in the sky.

Where will this one end up? Could it be your local 76 station?

item.title: The Red Ball Cometh, The Orange Ball Falls
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: What's that looming out of the gray San Fernando Valley gloom? Why, it's a shiny new 76 Ball, in ConocoPhillips' signature liver red! Yes, our own J. Eric Freedner has spotted one of the first of the new red 76 Balls manufactured to appease some of the upset caused by the destruction of the classic […]
item.content:encoded:
What's that looming out of the gray San Fernando Valley gloom? Why, it's a shiny new 76 Ball, in ConocoPhillips' signature liver red! Yes, our own J. Eric Freedner has spotted one of the first of the new red 76 Balls manufactured to appease some of the upset caused by the destruction of the classic orange spheres, and reports in with photographic proof.

While we far prefer Ray Pedersen's original color scheme of warm sunshine orange and rich cornflower blue, we're happy to herald the birth of a new 76 Ball, especially when so many of the classic balls continue to be killed. Check out this disturbing OCRegister Travels with Gary blog post, suggested by commenter ocwarner, but only if you have a sturdy stomach. The image of the worker using an acetylene torch on the 76 Ball's pole is especially poignant. These are the clearest photos we've seen yet of the murder of a 76 Ball.

But it's simply too horrible to show on these pages. Here are a couple more shots of the new red ball at 6003 Woodman Ave. (at Oxnard) in Van Nuys instead.

Long live the mighty 76 Ball! If you see a red ball in your town, please comment below.

item.title: The Sacramento Mystery Ball In Motion
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: Jeremy Sanford shot this live action footage of the one known example of a 3D 76 Ball in the new red and blue color scheme. ConocoPhillips is tearing down all the classic orange balls; why did they erect one red ball in Sacramento?
item.content:encoded: Jeremy Sanford shot this live action footage of the one known example of a 3D 76 Ball in the new red and blue color scheme. ConocoPhillips is tearing down all the classic orange balls; why did they erect one red ball in Sacramento?
